meaningMnemonic: This word is made up of a kanji with some hiragana attached, ending in an う sound. That means this word is a verb. The kanji itself means "correct," so what is the verb form of that? It would be <vocabulary>to correct</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

After you correct something for someone, you yell out <reading>ta-da</reading> (ただ) very excitedly. Go ahead and imagine yourself doing this a few times to help you to remember.
